body:
Looks like the file was not there when the analyzer process started. This could happen if AndroidHeapDumper#cleanup was called before, maybe because the main application process restarted.

We need to think about the transactional aspects. Both processes can die at any point without cleaning up.

issue.title: Fallback LeakCanary directory to app storage.

repository.name: leakcanary
repository.description: A memory leak detection library for Android.

issue.body:
On some devices we can't write to the external storage directory Downloads folder.

We should provide automatic fallback. When the permission is missing, we could still show the notification for permission, but in the meantime we can store the heapdump in the app directory. And of course there's the case where the permission is granted, but we still can't write to it, so we'd write there as well.

We'd have to remember to clean it up on startup even when the Downloads directory is available. Basically clean up both.

debugCompile 'com.squareup.leakcanary:leakcanary-android:1.4'
Android version:5.1.1

issue.title: Improvements to heap dumping

repository.name: leakcanary
repository.description: A memory leak detection library for Android.

issue.body:
- No more cleanup on startup, and no hanging heap dump if the analysis crashes. We create a distinct "pending" hprof for each heap dump, and those are cleaned up as part of the hprof file rotation.
- If a pending hprof hasn't been removed in 10 minutes, LeakCanary now assumes no analysis is in progress, and starts dumping the heap again.
- We now use the app directory as a fallback if the external storage directory isn't available. This is transparent to the user.
- If the external storage permission isn't granted, we show the notification as before but we also immediately fallback to the app directory, so that leak isn't lost.
- Leak notifications now each use a distinct notification instead of erasing each other.
- If LeakCanary can't perform a heap dump for any reason (e.g. analysis in progress, debugger attached ), it retries later with an exponential backoff.

Fixes #595.
Fixes #612.
